pageContext.claim: “San Diego has asked us to go forward with their section of the wall in California.  And rather than not doing that and letting them lobby for us with Governor Brown, we decided to do it.  And we’ll have a little bit less of a lobby, but we’ll have a lot of people happy in San Diego.”
pageContext.analysis: It's not clear what Trump is referring to, but in response to similar questions, the White House previously pointed out a project in Imperial County, east of San Diego, to replace two miles of an existing barrier with a bollard-style fence. The White House also told PolitiFact about a separate "border wall system" Trump's administration has proposed for the San Diego area. In any case, these projects are being driven by the federal government, not by local officials. The Republican mayor of San Diego has said, "We already have a safe and secure border in San Diego built by the federal government."
